restapi package¶

Submodules¶

restapi.admin module¶

restapi.apps module¶

class restapi.apps.RestapiConfig(app_name, app_module)¶

Bases: django.apps.config.AppConfig

name = 'restapi'¶

restapi.costumviews module¶

class restapi.costumviews.CreateListRetrieveViewSet(**kwargs)¶

Bases: rest_framework.mixins.CreateModelMixin, rest_framework.mixins.ListModelMixin, rest_framework.mixins.RetrieveModelMixin, rest_framework.viewsets.GenericViewSet

A viewset that provides retrieve, create, and list actions.

To use it, override the class and set the .queryset and .serializer_class attributes.

restapi.databaseutils module¶

class restapi.databaseutils.Date(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.expressions.Func

This class represents the mySQL function ‘DATE’. You can use it like Date(…) in query expressions.

function = 'DATE'¶
class restapi.databaseutils.FromUnixtime(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.expressions.Func

This class represents the mySQL function ‘FROM_UNIXTIME’. You can use it like FromUnixtime(…) in query expressions.

function = 'FROM_UNIXTIME'¶
class restapi.databaseutils.UnixTimestamp(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: django.db.models.expressions.Func

This class represents the mySQL function ‘UNIX_TIMESTAMP’. You can use it like UnixTimestamp(…) in query expressions.

function = 'UNIX_TIMESTAMP'¶
restapi.databaseutils.calculate_timedelta(start, end=datetime.datetime(2020, 8, 15, 12, 51, 20, 745539))¶

restapi.dataprocessing module¶

restapi.dataprocessing.add_timestamps_and_session_ids(mapped, time, session_id)¶
restapi.dataprocessing.cast_types(data)¶
restapi.dataprocessing.cast_units(values_dict)¶
restapi.dataprocessing.check_intervall(key, val)¶

This method checks the intervall of the posted data as defined in the VALIDATION_INTERVALLS dict. If a value is not within the intervall it raises a ValueError.

restapi.dataprocessing.create_basic_dict(data)¶

This method creates the basic dictionary structure to map the raw sensor data structure into the internally used data structure.

restapi.dataprocessing.map_keys(data)¶
restapi.dataprocessing.map_sensor_data(data, session_id)¶

Ensures data mapping to fit database schema. Therefore is takes the post format of the raspi as input and mappes it to the proper database format.

restapi.dataprocessing.validate(data)¶

This method checks the intervall and logs errors.

user¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

user_id¶

class restapi.views.BatteryViewSet(**kwargs)¶

Bases: rest_framework.viewsets.ReadOnlyModelViewSet

aggregate(request)¶
basename = None¶
description = None¶
detail = None¶
get_queryset()¶

Get the list of items for this view. This must be an iterable, and may be a queryset. Defaults to using self.queryset.

This method should always be used rather than accessing self.queryset directly, as self.queryset gets evaluated only once, and those results are cached for all subsequent requests.

You may want to override this if you need to provide different querysets depending on the incoming request.

(Eg. return a list of items that is specific to the user)

class restapi.views.DataVolumeViewSet(**kwargs)¶

Bases: rest_framework.viewsets.ReadOnlyModelViewSet

aggregate_by_day(request)¶

This method sums up the data volume per day. It returns the data volume for every day of the current month.

class restapi.views.GetStates(**kwargs)¶

class restapi.views.ImageUploadView(**kwargs)¶

Bases: restapi.costumviews.CreateListRetrieveViewSet

basename = None¶
create(request, *args, **kwargs)¶

This method receives posted images, validates them, saves the size of the image and writes the image to the file system and its referenece into the database.

restapi.views.RASPI_IP_ADDR = '127.0.0.1'¶

This file conatains viewsets for all basic funtions of CRUD and also special views if necessary. Additionally it contains the view to receive the sensor-data from the raspi.

class restapi.views.WindViewSet(**kwargs)¶

Bases: restapi.costumviews.CreateListRetrieveViewSet

aggregate(request)¶
static aggregate_on_queryset(queryset)¶
basename = None¶
description = None¶
detail = None¶
get_queryset()¶

Get the list of items for this view. This must be an iterable, and may be a queryset. Defaults to using self.queryset.

This method should always be used rather than accessing self.queryset directly, as self.queryset gets evaluated only once, and those results are cached for all subsequent requests.

You may want to override this if you need to provide different querysets depending on the incoming request.

(Eg. return a list of items that is specific to the user)

name = None¶
query_param_recent = 'lasthours'¶
queryset = <QuerySet []>¶
recent(request)¶

This method will return the wind data of the last 3 hours by default. If query parameter “lasthours” is set it will use this number instead of the default value.

serializer_class¶

alias of restapi.serializers.WindSerializer

suffix = None¶
restapi.views.filter_by_dates(date_range, queryset)¶

This method checks if query parameters for filtering by dates are there and then filters on the given queryset. If only parameter ‘start’ was set ‘end’ will implicitly be today.

restapi.views.get_client_ip(request)¶
restapi.views.get_or_create_measurement_session(session_id)¶
restapi.views.receive_sensor_data(self, request, *args, **kwargs)¶

This API view is resposible to receive the sensor data from the raspi. Therefore it mappes and validates the data and saves it to the specific tables in the database.

restapi.views.store_data(serializer)¶
restapi.views.update_last_post_time()¶
